thread.title_full: Proxy adviser ISS recommends Mylan shareholders vote against Perrigo deal - MarketWatch

author: Liz Hoffman
title: Proxy adviser ISS recommends Mylan shareholders vote against Perrigo deal
text:
Bloomberg Institutional Shareholder Services, an influential shareholder-vote adviser, recommends that Mylan NV investors vote against authorizing the company’s $36 billion takeover of Perrigo Co., saying the deal faces too many hurdles.
The ISS report, issued Friday to the firm’s clients, cited “unreasonable uncertainties,” including that Dublin-based Perrigo’s PRGO, +1.53% shareholders may reject the offer. The cash-and-stock bid, which Perrigo’s board has called inadequate, is currently worth just under $200 a share, down from $232 when it was unveiled in April.
That price “could be inadequate to win over enough Perrigo shareholders to complete the acquisition,” ISS wrote.
A Mylan MYL, +0.41% spokesperson didn’t immediately comment on the recommendation.
Mylan stockholders are expected to vote Aug. 28 on whether to issue new shares to fund the acquisition.
Mylan said this week it was prepared to close a tender offer after receiving just a simple majority of Perrigo shares, rather than the 80% required under Irish law to take a company fully private. ISS said that raised the risk that Mylan would be stuck as a large shareholder in another public company with no certain path toward owning the rest.
An expanded version of this report appears at WSJ.com.
